H0.text: Blood is the means by which traits are passed on from one generation to the next in living things.

H1.text: Minerals are the substances transferred in living organisms to pass traits from one generation to the next.

H2.text: Calories are transferred from one generation to the next in living things to pass on traits.

H3.text: DNA is the material transferred in living things that passes traits from one generation to the next.

A4.text: DNA contains the genetic information that allows all forms of life to function, grow and reproduce.

A5.text: Transmission of genetic information in genes is achieved via complementary base pairing.
